item.title: How to Date Mateo Manta in Date Everything
item.description:
Date Everything is a wholesome, sometimes raunchy, dating simulation released by Sassy Chap Games. Players will find over 100 Dateables who will knock them off their feet with charm or absurdity.

Mateo Manta is one of the sweetest and softest Dateables in Date Everything . If players want to date him, they must help reunite him with his Inanimal friends. This requires going on a little scavenger hunt to find the cute beasts. Here are all the Inanimal locations in Date Everything.

How to Date Mateo Manta in Date Everything

Mateo is Dateable 29

Mateo is the blanket in Date Everything , and players will find him in a few places. One obvious one is draped across one of the chairs in the living room. However, whenever players first talk to Mateo, he will be distressed because one of his pets has run away.

Mateo runs an Inanimal shelter where he takes care of the various pets made from lint, thread, and even soap. His Inanimal named Davi has gone missing, and helping him is the key to Mateo's heart. Say the following during the first conversation:

  • What's going on?
  • Who is Davi?
  • Hrm maybe, what's he look like?
  • Poor thing...
  • But you said he keeps going missing?
  • Who is your little friend there?
  • I don't think she did it... look how cute she is!
  • I belong to her now.
  • Is she friendly?
  • I'm willing to take that chance.
  • Is there anything I can do to help?
  • Really, it's no trouble.
  • You've got to lighten up on yourself.
  • You're not very good at accepting help, are you?
  • You've got a big heart. I'm sure they are grateful to have you!
  • I'd love that.

If players talk to Mateo without searching for Davi, they can still get to know him, but won't progress towards one of his endings. They'll find him talking to characters like Dolly, Sinclair, and more.

How to Find Davi in Date Everything

All Inanimal Locations

After the first conversation, players should speak with Phoenicia, one of the other Dateables, to recruit her assistance in finding the Inanimals. They can do this the same day they talk to Mateo, to prepare to speak with him the next day. Choose the following options during the next conversation with Mateo:

  • Looks like you've got your hands full.
  • Seems like I could've done more?
  • So these are the cuties I've heard so much about.
  • And who gets to pamper you?
  • How 'bout you let me pamper you? Like on date?
  • Yeah, of course.

Laundry Room Inanimal Location (1)

The first Inanimal that players will need to find is in the laundry room. Mateo will instruct them to speak with Hoove, but players can locate the Inanimal right away. Scan the vine on the windowsill next to Harper. Players will find a serpentine Inanimal. It will hop into their pocket and go. The snake will be revealed to have a piece of Davi in it when players take it back to Mateo.

Scanning an Inanimal counts as scanning Mateo, so players will have to talk to him the next day.

Living Room Inanimal Location (2)

After talking to Mateo, he will give players a hint that the next Inanimal was caught up in Connie's or Luna's cords. The Inanimal will spawn on the Entertainment Center, resembling a curly wire. The Inanimal looks like a mechanical mouse, and like the snake, it has a piece of Davi attached to it.

Davi Location

The final hint will be to take a look at the Gym near Kristof and Fantina. Players will find Davi inside the Gym closet underneath a box. Players can reunite Davi and Mateo the next day. They can also hint at wanting a romantic relationship with him by saying the following:

  • It's more like he found me.
  • He did, it looked like he was protecting them.
  • Is this the one you lost?
  • I really don't think you did anything wrong.
  • They're lucky to have someone who refused to give up on them.
  • I don't want to leave you either.
  • Yeah. I'd like that. Like a lot.

Players will need to speak with Mateo one more time to obtain his Love ending. They will earn points in the Empathy SPECS category. They can get Mateo's true ending by turning him into a human with his Realization Recipe:

Dateable

Smarts

Poise

Empathy

Charm

Sass

Mateo

5

45

100

100

8 Images
8 Images
Date Everything!
8.6 /10
Released
June 17, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Sassy Chap Games
Publisher(s)
Team17
Powered by

item.title: Persona: Best Mascot Characters, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Lufel, the newest mascot, is stylish but still needs time to shine.
  • Teddie from Persona 4 is loyal but can be overbearing with his puns.
  • Koromaru in Persona 3 is a simple, charming dog with a strong presence.

The Persona franchise has its fair share of charismatic characters. Whether it be the loudmouthed Ryuji from Persona 5 , the dorky but steadfast Chie from Persona 4 , or the snarky yet kindhearted Yukari from Persona 3 , these characters have captured the minds and hearts of players from around the world. Along those lines, one thing the Persona series is known for is its eye-catching mascot characters.

These characters, whether they are humanoid or not, have certain features that immediately draw prospective players' attention to them. They're marketable, that's for sure, but they're also well-developed, likable, and so unbelievably memorable. With this type of character coming into prominence starting in Persona 3 , there's been plenty of time to decide which Persona mascot characters are the best of the best.

6 Lufel (Persona 5: The Phantom X)

New and Fly

6 Images
6 Images
Persona5: The Phantom X
JRPG
RPG
Adventure
Systems
Developer(s)
Black Wings Game Studio, Atlus, Sega

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Were the Phantom Thieves, and were here to steal your heart!
The beloved RPG series with over 22 million copies sold finally arrives on PC and mobile!

Set in modern-day Tokyo!
Normal high-school student by day, villain-fighting Phantom Thief by night!

Explore the dungeons of the heart and defeat the distorted enemy Shadows!
Dive into dungeons of the heart called Palaces with your fellow Phantom Thieves, who have awakened their Persona, the power of the heart. Steal the Treasure to restore the warped heart!

Stylish, snappy, and satisfying turn-based combat!
Experience the signature flair of the Persona series with striking visuals and addictive moves that can wipe out all your foes in one swoop!

Level up your Persona, the power of your heart, and become the most powerful Persona-user!
Obtain new Personas, infiltrate dungeons of the heart, and prevent a future of ruin!

Enjoy your youth as a student!
Savor student life in an urban metropolis as a high-school student! How you spend your days after school is up to youdeepen your friendships, devote your time to clubs, or even work part-time!

Interact with a variety of fascinating characters!
Tons of new characters inhabit the game, created under the supervision of Shigenori Soejima and the rest of the Persona team!

Publisher(s)
Perfect World Entertainment, Atlus
Engine
Unity
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Cross-Platform Play
Yes
Prequel(s)
Persona 5
Franchise
Persona
Number of Players
Single-player
Steam Deck Compatibility
Unknown
Platform(s)
PC, Android, iOS
Powered by

Lufel is the newest entry into the mascot family, so his placement isn't necessarily the fairest. Due to being a main character in a live-service game, Lufel, or as he's known through his codename, Cattle , hasn't been given the proper time to really shine. As of right now, he's essentially Morgana-lite, too, acting as a guide to the Metaverse for the Persona 5: The Phantom X cast.

What he does have all to his own is his sleek design and brilliant Persona, Robroy . As an Owl, he's given a lot more to do in the real world, not being relegated to his respective MC's bag. His stylish jacket and his striking tonfa make his Metaverse look shine, while his cool goggles carry between both worlds as quite the memorable prop. With a promising start, as the story of Persona 5: The Phantom X continues, Lufel could find himself climbing the ranks quite quickly.

5 Teddie (Persona 4)

Occasionally Unbearable

Persona 4 Golden
11
9.0 /10
Released
December 9, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

The world-renowned Persona 4 Golden promises unforgettable adventures, meaningful bonds, and heartwarming experiences shared together with friends. They say your soulmate will appear if you stare into a television set on a rainy night This strange rumor slowly spreads through the rural town of Inaba, the protagonists new home, just as a chain of mysterious murders begin. As the protagonist and his teammates chase after the truth, they find themselves opening the door to another world.

Explore otherworldly dungeons, take down monstrous Shadows, and confront the darker sides of one's self as you inch closer to the truth behind the serial murder cases. Venture around the town of Inaba, partake in an eventful school year, meet kindred spirits, and forge invaluable bonds. New quality of life features including improved graphics and smoothness, difficulty selection and quick save functionality.

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Alcohol Reference, Animated Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Atlus
Publisher(s)
Atlus
Engine
RenderWare
Franchise
Persona
Platform(s)
PC, PS Vita, PS4, Switch, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
How Long To Beat
70 Hours
X|S Optimized
Yes
File Size Xbox Series
10 GB (November 2023)
Powered by

Persona 4 's mascot, Teddie , sticks with the Investigation Team through thick and thin and will fight like nobody else for his friends. His loyalty is undeniable, but so is his constant barrage of bear-based puns, and his uncomfortable approach to characters like Chie and Yukiko. There's a lot of good about Teddie, but with that good comes quite a fair bit of bad. And if not bad, really just "a lot."

His Persona, Kintoki-Douji, perfectly meshes with Teddie's look and attitude. It's silly, but powerful, just the same as Teddie. Once Teddie gains his human form, it begins to raise more worrying thoughts about his treatment of his female companions. Hopefully, in Persona 4 Revival , he'll be a little bit better, but for now, Teddie is a charming yet heavily flawed bear.

4 Koromaru (Persona 3)

The Best Boy

Persona 3 Reload
9 /10
13
9.2 /10
Released
February 2, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Step into the shoes of a transfer student thrust into an unexpected fate when entering the hour "hidden" between one day and the next. Awaken an incredible power and chase the mysteries of the Dark Hour, fight for your friends, and leave a mark on their memories forever.
Persona 3 Reload is a captivating reimagining of the genre-defining RPG, reborn for the modern era.
Experience the pivotal game of the Persona series faithfully remade with cutting-edge graphics, modernized quality-of-life features, and signature stylish UI. Fully immerse yourself in an emotional, gripping journey with new scenes, character interactions, and additional voiceover. Choose how to meaningfully spend each day through various activities from exploring the Port Island to forging genuine bonds with beloved characters. Build and command your optimal team to take down otherworldly Shadows and climb closer to the truth.

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
P-Studio
Publisher(s)
Atlus
Engine
Unreal Engine 4
Franchise
Persona
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, PS4, PS5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
How Long To Beat
50 Hours
Powered by

Having a cute dog have control over a destructive power is always a recipe for a good time, and Persona 3 's very own Koromaru is exactly that. He acts as a ray of shining light in Persona 3 's constant dour story. A sweet dog that's completely loyal up until the very end, it's hard not to love him just the same as how he loves everyone else.

Koromaru has a pretty simple design, but his simplicity is what makes him so charming. He's an adorable Shiba Inu, with small flourishes that make him stand out on his own. The same goes for Persona 3 's version of Cerberus , Koromaru's Persona. Koromaru is simple on the surface, with just that little bit more under the collar. His simplicity is his charm.

3 Sophia (Persona 5 Strikers)

A Digital Darling

Persona 5 Strikers
8 /10
8.2 /10
Released
February 3, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Join the Phantom Thieves and strike back against the corruption overtaking cities across Japan. A summer vacation with close friends takes a sudden turn as a distorted reality emerges; reveal the truth and redeem the hearts of those imprisoned at the center of the crisis!

Jump into the stylish world of Persona in an all-new story. Dynamically control your team during explosive action combat. Battle across Japan in an epic road trip

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Omega Force, P-Studio
Publisher(s)
Atlus
Engine
Proprietary Engine
Franchise
Persona
Platform(s)
PS4, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
How Long To Beat
35 Hours
Powered by

Persona 5 Strikers ' Sophia is the second Persona series mascot character that's comprised of 0s and 1s, and despite being from a spin-off, she makes quite the impression. Half of the intrigue of mascot characters is the mystery that comes along with them, and Sophia's connection with EMMA brings up so many questions throughout the game, it'd drive any player to want to learn more.

Her upbeat attitude and her slowly becoming accustomed to human ways are a joy to watch, and her appropriately chosen Metaverse codename being Sophie , just adds to that. Pithos , her "Persona," adds more to her mystery, and what happens to it later adds to her appeal. Her character arc is full and satisfying, and every aspect of her comes together to create a perfect follow-up to the original Persona 5 .

2 Morgana (Persona 5)

Bona Fide Mona Fide

Persona 5 Royal
10 /10
16
9.5 /10
Released
March 31, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Don the mask and join the Phantom Thieves of Hearts as they stage grand heists, infiltrate the minds of the corrupt, and make them change their ways! Prepare for the award-winning RPG experience in this definitive edition of Persona 5 Royal, featuring a treasure trove of downloadable content included!

Forced to transfer to a high school in Tokyo, the protagonist has a strange dream. You truly are a prisoner of fate. In the near future, ruin awaits you. With the goal of rehabilitation looming overhead, he must save others from distorted desires by donning the mask of a Phantom Thief.

Explore Tokyo, unlock Personas, customize your own personal Thieves Den, experience alternate endings, and more. Become the ultimate Phantom Thief and defy conventions, discover the power within, and fight for justice in the definitive version of Persona 5 Royal.

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Atlus, P-Studio
Publisher(s)
Atlus
Engine
Proprietary Engine
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Franchise
Persona
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
How Long To Beat
100 Hours
PS Plus Availability
N/A
Powered by

If dogs can work as a good partner to fight off shadows, Persona 5 's purr-fect Phantom Thief, Morgana, shows that cats can do it just as well. One of the very first characters the player meets, Morgana makes a strong impression. He's funny, can be serious, and shows the full extent of what a Persona-wielder is capable of. Morgana's Persona, Zorro , isn't just a cool design; he has some power and healing to back it up, too.

A sleek, friendly, plushie-able design goes a long way in making a character visually appealing, and Morgana checks off every single box. He's cool, cute, and an absolute blast to follow. His interactions with the Phantom Thieves, and Joker specifically, endear him so well. Sure, he can be moody and a little overbearing, but with his dream of being a human, having those qualities means he's nearly there.

1 Aigis (Persona 3)

0s and Number 1s

A mascot character so good Persona 3 gave her her very own DLC, Aigis is beloved for a reason. Her sleek, robotic design is like no other, especially back when Persona 3 first came out. Her persona, Palladion , matches her aesthetic perfectly. She's smart, weird, capable, and clearly an expert at confrontation; it's hard not to see this super fighting robot and be won over immediately.

She's a well-rounded character, one with attachments so deep with the MC, she's romancable. She's more than just a marketable face; she's the beating heart of Persona 3 , all while not having a biological one. Even if she didn't have her own playable story, she'd still likely take the first place spot.

item.title: Persona 5 Phantom X: Gardening Guide
item.description:
Persona5: The Phantom X has a lot of mechanics that involve in-game time, even though this game doesn't have a set calendar system like the mainline series does. While a lot of these mechanics can be ignored to complete the main story of the game and all the Palaces, these mechanics can add to the overall experience and help you get stronger in various ways.

Synergy Bonds are a major part of the game, letting players get closer to the various people they meet, much like Social Links. Giving gifts is a great way to help rank up these Synergy Bonds, and gardening is a key way to get a lot of gifts to give; here's how it all works.

Where to Get Seeds for Gardening in Persona 5 X

There are two flower shops that sell seeds for you to plant in Persona 5 X :

  • Flower Shop in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Flower Shop in Shinjuku Red-light District

While there are other, more straightforward ways to get gifts or cooking ingredients, seeds cost a lot less and only require a few days of in-game time to grow into a useful gift or cooking ingredient. You can also get seeds randomly when completing City Actions, such as cleaning the house.

How to Garden in Persona 5 Phantom X

Gardening can be done anytime in Wonder's house on the first floor and out the back door. There will be two small pots and a long pot on both sides of the garden, letting you plant up to six different seeds at a time. All you need to do to garden is plant a seed and wait the specified amount of time for the plant to grow. When planting something, you can use Fertilizer to speed up the process and get the plants sooner.

Fertilizer is also purchased in Flower Shops.

Advancing time does require Action Points, and while gardening doesn't use Action Points, it will require the use of a lot of Action Points on other things . You'll need to use enough to progress the day and sleep to the next day, even possibly completing a few actions the next day, to reach the correct amount of time. Once grown, just interact with the pot again to get the resulting plant, with them staying there as long as needed, so no worries if you happen to forget about your plants for a long time.

Gardening also gives Kindness when collecting plants.

What Do You Do With Plants in P5X?

Plants can be used in the workbench to be crafted into gifts for your synergy bonds or used in the kitchen to make a consumable. The resulting use of a grown plant can be seen when buying the seeds and whenever you plant them, so you'll know exactly what you're setting yourself up for. Some recipes will require you to rank up other Synergy Bonds or get other materials in order to craft the final item.

6 Images
6 Images
Follow
Followed
Persona5: The Phantom X

item.title: Persona 5 Phantom X: Gift Giving Guide
item.description:
There are many Synergy Bonds to get close to in Persona 5 Phantom X . While upon release there are only a few to meet, new companions are constantly added to the game, so it's important to be efficient with your time and rank them up even through there's no calender system like in the mainline series.

Giving Gifts is an easy way to get additional Synergy Points for any bond; it's just important to know where to get gifts and also how to give them to your bonds. There are many places to buy gifts, and the game will clearly display who would like a gift. Here are all the places you can buy gifts at, along with how to give them to your bonds.

How to Give Gifts in Persona 5 Phantom X

You can give gifts to a Synergy Bond anytime you are hanging out with them, not for a major rank. You can tell when this is just a normal hangout, and you can give a gift when the words in the yellow bubble say, "Big Rewards" instead of, "Form Bonds". At the end of a hangout, you'll get the option to choose from any of the gifts you have to give to that bond, with the Synergy Boost listed over each reward to help make sure you make the best decision.

Earning additional Synergy Points will make a major rank hangout appear earlier , so giving the right gift can help you save your action points and have to hang out with a character fewer times between the major hangouts. In the Synergy Menu, you can also see the likes of a person to know what items you should purchase and give them as a gift to get the best results.

Your bonds won't be available to hang out with every day, and it's only a chance of them appearing during their usual time during your City Activity each day. You can increase the likelihood of a Bond appearing each day by prioritizing it in the Synergy menu , with you being able to prioritize one bond for each time of day.

Where to Buy Gifts in Persona 5 X

There are many places to buy gifts to give, and when scrolling through the menu, you'll see a portrait of the character who would like that gift the most, so you can make the right purchase. You can also craft gifts at the Workbench using plants grown in the garden, though this takes a few steps and costs many Action Points. All the stores that sell gifts are:

  • 777 Convenience Store in Shibuya Central Street
  • Cosmetics Store in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Accessory Shop in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Japanese Sundries Shop in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Gourmet Supermarket in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Jewelry Store in Shibuya Underground Mall
  • Jewelry Store in Shinjuku Red-light District
  • Convenience Store in Shinjuku Red-light District

item.title: 6 Horror Games With The Biggest Twist Ending, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Horror games with shocking twists often have the best storytelling in the genre.
  • Unexpected plot turns, tough subjects, and fourth-wall breaks create unforgettable finales.
  • From BioShock's Atlas twist to Soma's chilling revelation, countless horror games deliver disturbing surprises.

Horror games are always designed with the goal in mind of horrifying and shocking the player, often utilizing many means to do this, such as the infamous jump scare, terrifying monster designs, or even by using an unsettling ambience to disquiet the player. But this would all be meaningless without a thrilling plot to follow.

A game's plot can also be used for shock value, as it could grapple with tough subjects, have horrifying implications that the player learns as they progress, or completely pull the rug out from under one's feet by providing them with a shocking twist ending. Here are some notable horror games that feature incredibly shocking twist endings that players could simply never prepare themselves for.

6 Doki Doki Literature Club

A Fourth Wall-Breaking Finale

3 Images
3 Images
Doki Doki Literature Club!
Visual Novel
Horror
Systems
Released
September 22, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Team Salvato
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Despite the warning issued at the beginning of the game informing players of dark and disturbing imagery, it's still hard to be prepared for exactly what happens in Doki Doki . After spending a while becoming acquainted with the other members of the poetry club and exchanging work with them, the game takes a turn for the worst, and the player character's long-time friend Sayuri commits suicide.

But this is just the tip of the iceberg of horror, as the end of the game breaks the fourth wall, having Monika address the player directly and deleting some of the game files on their PC as a way to keep the two of them together forever. It was nothing short of disturbing and shocking to witness, and it made for a game finale players would not soon forget.

5 BioShock

There Was Never an Atlas

BioShock
13
9.4 /10
Released
August 21, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Irrational Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

BioShock is a game full of twists and turns, from the first reveal of Rapture during the game's opening to the ending twist that shines some light on Jack's helpful guide, who was basically tutorial man. Every request given by the helpful Atlas was garnished with the phrase "Would you kindly?" This was revealed to be a phrase that would trigger Jack to become obedient and follow whatever command was given.

This was just one of the twists, as the other was that Atlas never really existed, and it was the criminal Frank Fontaine he had been talking with all this time, using Jack for his own gain. It was quite a shock that the person they had been relying on to guide them this whole time was a man thought to be dead.

4 Dead Space

Nicole Has Been Dead This Whole Time

Dead Space
10
9.1 /10
Released
October 14, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Visceral Games
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, Xbox 360
Powered by

Throughout all of Isaac's exploration of the Ishimura, it is believed by him (and the players) that his girlfriend Nicole is alive, giving him a helping hand, especially during the game's final chapter. They discover the Marker and the Hive Mind are responsible for causing hallucinations and necromorphs, and they set about to stop them from infecting everyone. This is when Dead Space pummels the player not just with one twist, but two.

Kendra is a double agent working for the Earth Government under orders to secure the Marker and take it back with her, and Nicole is nothing more than a hallucination born from the Marker to manipulate Isaac. These were not only shocking twists that would have players' jaws on the floor, but also tragic in regard to the truth about Nicole. Players could only imagine the horror and pain Isaac felt at that moment.

3 Resident Evil Village

Ethan Did Not Survive the Baker's

Resident Evil Village
8 /10
24
9.0 /10
Released
May 7, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Stadia, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Poor Ethan did not have an easy time of it. First, he had to escape the dangerous Baker family transformed by Eveline's "gifts." Then, he had to save his infant daughter from Miranda and her Four Lords. These sound like situations that no normal person would survive, and well, in Ethan's case, he didn't, but this is not something players would find out about until the end of Resident Evil Village .

Granted, there were a few context clues, such as Ethan being able to reattach entire limbs with just a bottle of medicine, but most assumed this was just game mechanics rather than related to the games' lore. But then the reveal comes, shocking most players even as they slapped their foreheads and yelled "Of course!" After all, the amount of times Ethan's hand was injured, mangled, and cut clean off was a little suspicious. Unfortunately, his regenerative powers hit their limit at the climax of Village , so Ethan made the ultimate sacrifice so that his daughter could be taken to safety.

2 Soma

Only a Copy is Sent to ARK

SOMA
8 /10
9.8 /10
Released
September 15, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Developer(s)
Frictional Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Soma was a bit of a risky gambit for Frictional Games, who were known previously for their indie horror hits such as Penumbra and Amnesia . Even the former game didn't delve too hard into philosophy and sci-fi, but Soma does without hesitation. Players are confronted with some pretty hard-hitting questions as they explore the underwater station as Simon Jarrett, a man who agreed to an experimental brain scan after a traffic accident left him with damage to his brain.

He meets Catherine and learns about the fate of humanity and possible salvation: ARK, which may just be his and Catherine's ticket out of PATHOS. The whole game leads up to this, and when the moment finally arrives, Simon's celebrations come to an abrupt end. He is still in the derelict station, and that's when Catherine elaborates: Only copies of them were sent. While there is a Catherine and a Simon aboard ARK, the Simon and Catherine stuck on PATHOS are indeed stuck there forever. Such a hopeless ending was almost impossible to predict, serving as a shocking and horrifying conclusion.

1 Silent Hill 2

James Killed Mary

10 Images
10 Images
Silent Hill 2
9.0 /10
Released
September 25, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Violence
Developer(s)
Team Silent
Platform(s)
PlayStation 2, Xbox (Original), PC

Mighty

Granted, the ending of Silent Hill 2 is basically common knowledge due to its age, the remake released back in 2024, and not to mention questionable merch choices by Konami. But for anyone who played the original or, by some miracle, has dodged every spoiler up until now, getting to the end of the game gave players one shocking and utterly gut-wrenching ending.

All along, players have been fed the narrative by James that it was a terminal illness that killed Mary, but it was James himself. This is revealed by a videotape acquired towards the end of the game. Watching it shows the action of James smothering Mary with a pillow, forcing him, and the player, to confront this grizzly and horrifying truth. Silent Hill, the monsters, and Pyramid Head all serve to make him pay penance for his crimes, which he himself deep inside felt the desire to be punished for. It's a truly shocking twist ending, and it gave rise to one of the most complex protagonists of all time.
